174.article_body: As many as 12 students of SSRVM Senior Secondary School were injured after their bus fell 20-30 m from the road. The incident took place near Lamlehri Upperli bend in Una. All the students on the bus were rescued and taken to a regional hospital in Una. The condition of three of the injured students is serious, an official said.

175.title: Boy barred from giving Guj class 12 board exams for bribing examiner
175.article_body: A class 12 student has been debarred from giving the Gujarat board examinations for a year, as he allegedly tried to bribe an examiner, an official said on Friday. The science stream student is accused of attaching a ₹500 note to his answer sheet in this year's examinations. The boy is among 22 science stream students who faced disciplinary action.

176.title: 24 Pakistani refugees get Indian citizenship in Gujarat's Rajkot
176.article_body: At least 24 refugees, mostly Hindus, from Pakistan were granted Indian citizenship by authorities in Gujarat's Rajkot on Friday, an official said. Gujarat Minister of State for Home Harsh Sanghavi handed over citizenship certificates to them, an official release stated. "My family has been waiting for...16 years to get Indian citizenship," a youngster pursuing career in aviation sector said.

177.title: Glad TN got 5th elephant reserve in Tirunelveli's Agathiyamalai: Stalin
177.article_body: On World Elephant Day, Tamil Nadu CM MK Stalin said he was glad the state got its fifth elephant reserve at Tirunelveli's Agathiyamalai. "Elephants play a critical role in balancing...forest ecosystems," he tweeted. This comes after the Union Environment Ministry made an announcement accepting a proposal of the state forest department to notify the land as an elephant reserve.

178.title: Karnataka Cabinet passes aerospace and defence policy
178.article_body: The Karnataka Cabinet on Friday passed the 'Karnataka Aerospace and Defence Policy 2022-27' which aims to attract ₹45,000 crore investment. It offers incentives to manufacturing units and companies in the sector. "The aim is to make Karnataka a hub in aerospace and defence sectors. We want to strengthen the state's position...and encourage exports," Minister JC Madhuswamy said.

179.title: In touch with family: MEA after Indian-origin woman's suicide in US
179.article_body: Days after Indian-origin woman Mandeep Kaur died by suicide in US allegedly over domestic abuse, India's External Affairs Ministry on Friday informed that the Indian Consulate in New York is in touch with the family and local authorities. "Our embassy in Washington is in contact with the US authorities, who assured us of appropriate action," MEA Spokesperson said.

180.title: Terrible day for literature: Dalrymple on attack on Salman Rushdie
180.article_body: Following an attack on India-born author Salman Rushdie in the US on Friday, historian William Dalrymple tweeted, "A terrible day for literature, for freedom of speech and for authors everywhere." "Poor poor Salman: I pray he's not hurt and recovers quickly," he added. Rushdie, who wrote 'The Satanic Verses', was attacked as he was about to give a lecture.

181.title: Andhra govt bans 'derogatory and abusive' slang for Nayee Brahmins
181.article_body: The Andhra Pradesh government has banned the use of a few words in the local slang that are derogatory to the Nayee Brahmin community. "Any person using such abusive and prohibited words...shall be liable for action under the...Indian Penal Code," the order said. The new rule was brought in based on recommendations of the Backward Classes Welfare Department.

182.title: Boris Johnson has not returned my calls: Rishi Sunak
182.article_body: Britain's prime ministerial candidate Rishi Sunak said Prime Minister Boris Johnson has not returned his calls since he resigned from the UK Cabinet as Chancellor last month. Speaking to 'The Daily Telegraph', Sunak said, "I have messaged and called but, unsurprisingly, he hasn't returned my calls." Sunak and Foreign Secretary Liz Truss are contesting to become Britain's next Prime Minister.

183.title: 5 Chinese state-owned companies to delist from New York Stock Exchange amid US tensions
183.article_body: Five Chinese state-owned companies would delist from the New York Stock Exchange amid economic and diplomatic tensions with the United States. They include China Life Insurance, PetroChina, China Petroleum & Chemical, Aluminum Corporation of China Limited and Sinopec Shanghai Petrochemical. The five companies were flagged by the US securities regulator as failing to meet its auditing standards.

184.title: Kareena wishes Sara Ali Khan on her b'day, shares throwback pic
184.article_body: Actress Kareena Kapoor Khan took to her Instagram Stories on Friday to wish Sara Ali Khan on her birthday. Sharing a childhood picture of Sara with Saif Ali Khan, she wrote, "Happy Birthday darling Sara. Unlimited pizza and cakes for you today." Sara is the daughter of Saif from his first wife, Amrita Singh. Sara turned 27 on Friday.

185.title: Bihar Dy CM Tejashwi Yadav gets Z+ security cover, bulletproof car
185.article_body: The Bihar government on Friday granted Z+ security cover and a bulletproof car to Tejashwi Yadav, who took oath as the new Deputy Chief Minister of the state. According to an official, a circular to this effect was issued on Thursday and commandos of the Bihar Special Armed Police (BSAP) would be involved in the security of the RJD leader.

186.title: Rushdie suffered apparent stab wound to neck, his condition not known yet: NY Police
186.article_body: New York State Police have issued a statement in regard to the attack on author Salman Rushdie. "On August 12...at about 11 am, a male suspect ran up onto the stage and attacked Rushdie," the statement read. "Rushdie suffered an apparent stab wound to the neck, and was transported by helicopter to...[a]...hospital. His condition is not yet known," it added.

187.title: Police stop 'Har Ghar Tiranga' bike rally led by BJP leader in Bengal
187.article_body: Police stopped a 'Har Ghar Tiranga' bike rally led by BJP leader Suvendu Adhikari in West Bengal's Nandigram on Friday. They said the leader only had permission for 'padyatra', not bike journey. "A procession to campaign for hoisting the Indian National Flag is being prohibited...Does the [West Bengal] Administration feel that the state isn't a part of India?" Adhikari tweeted.

188.title: Over 2,500 houses destroyed in Sudan floods
188.article_body: Seasonal rains and floods have destroyed over 2,500 houses in east Sudan, leaving thousands homeless in what is an already impoverished region. The nationwide death toll from the rains is still undetermined. Since the monsoon season began in May, about 38,000 people have been affected by floods in Sudan, the UN Office for the Coordination of Humanitarian Affairs said.

189.title: ED freezes assets worth ₹370 crore of crypto exchange Vauld's India entity
189.article_body: The ED has frozen assets worth ₹370 crore of Flipvolt Technologies, the Indian entity of crypto exchange Vauld, in a money laundering case. "Lax KYC norms, loose regulatory control of allowing transfers to foreign wallets without asking any reason, non-recording of transactions on blockchains to save costs...has ensured...Flipvolt isn't able to give any account for missing crypto assets," ED said.

190.title: I love my boys but I wanted a daughter: Shefali Shah
190.article_body: Shefali Shah, who shares two sons with her filmmaker-husband Vipul Amrutlal Shah, said she wanted to have a daughter in both of her pregnancies. "I wanted a daughter. I love my boys, but I wanted a daughter, both...times," she said. Shefali was most recently seen in 'Darlings', in which she played a mother to Badrunissa Sheikh, played by Alia Bhatt.

191.title: This year's last Supermoon seen in skies across the world, pics surface
191.article_body: This year's third and last Supermoon has been spotted in night skies across the world, with pictures of the natural phenomenon being shared online. Referred to as the Sturgeon Moon, the Supermoon reached its zenith in the early hours of Friday morning. It appeared bigger than normal with orange hues.

192.title: Russian officials trained in Iran as part of drone deal: US
192.article_body: Russian officials received training in Iran over recent weeks as part of the agreement for transfer of drones from Iran to Russia, the US State Department said on Thursday. Last month, Washington said it had information that suggested Iran was preparing to provide Russia with up to a several hundred drones, including some "weapons-capable" ones, amid the Russia-Ukraine war.

193.title: China sanctions Lithuanian deputy minister over her Taiwan visit
193.article_body: China on Friday said that it has sanctioned Lithuania's Deputy Transport and Communications Minister, Agne Vaiciukeviciute, over her visit to Taiwan. China's foreign ministry said that all engagements between Beijing and Vaiciukeviciute's ministry would also be suspended. Lithuania's Ministry of Transport and Communications said it had not received any official information regarding the matter.

194.title: Fossil of small armour-plated dinosaur discovered in Argentina
194.article_body: The remains of a small armoured dinosaur that lived about 100 million years ago were discovered in Argentina. It likely walked upright on its back legs and weighed as much as a pet cat. Named Jakapil kaniukura, the dinosaur would have been well-protected with rows of bony disk-shaped armour along its neck and back, down to its tail, researchers said.

195.title: When will we discuss loan waivers to big corporations?: Congress
195.article_body: Congress on Friday asked when there will be a discussion on loan waivers to big corporations. "When will there be a discussion on freebies given by the public sector banks of ₹5.8 lakh crore in the last five years?" Congress spokesperson Gourav Vallabh asked. These comments come in the wake of PM Narendra Modi's criticism of the culture of 'freebies'.

196.title: Shah Rukh Khan's reported look from 'Brahmāstra' leaked online, pics go viral
196.article_body: Shah Rukh Khan's pictures, reportedly from 'Brahmāstra', were leaked online. The actor's first look as Vanarastra, inspired by Lord Hanuman, has gone viral on the internet. Reacting to it, a fan wrote, "I am getting goosebumps already" while another comment read, "This leaked footage is gold." "SRK’s presence...will make #Brahmāstra an even more exciting affair!" another Twitter user wrote.

197.title: Rare microscopic creatures discovered in Scottish caves
197.article_body: Researchers have discovered rare microscopic creatures, the tiny crustaceans named ostracods, in the Smoo Cave in Sutherland and Allt nan Uamh Stream Cave in Assynt. The creatures found are around one millimetre in size and were found residing in pools inside the caves. "Styglobitic creatures live entirely below the earth's surface," a researcher said.

198.title: RCB's official YouTube channel hacked, name changed to 'MicroStrategy'
198.article_body: The official YouTube channel of Royal Challengers Bangalore (RCB) was hacked, with hackers changing the name of the channel to 'MicroStrategy'. The hackers also posted a video with thumbnail reading, "Event Now...Hurry Up!" The channel was later removed, with "This account has been terminated for violating YouTube's Community Guidelines" message being displayed on opening the channel.

199.title: Minister TS Singhdeo's relative found dead near Bilaspur railway track
199.article_body: Chhattisgarh minister and Congress leader TS Singhdeo's relative Bir Bhadra Pratap was found dead near a railway track in Bilaspur's Belghana, police said on Friday. Bir Bhadra, who was popularly known as Sachin Singh, died after allegedly falling from a train, ANI reported. Chhattisgarh Police said post-mortem examination has been done.

200.title: Around 250 people executed in Iran this year
200.article_body: Iran executed around 250 people since the beginning of this year, human rights organisation Amnesty International said in a recent report. The number of executions this year is twice as many as the same period last year in Iran, the report added. In 2021, Iran is estimated to have executed 314 people, the second-highest rate of executions per capita.

201.title: Suryakumar Yadav buys Mercedes Benz GLS worth around ₹2 crore, pic surfaces
201.article_body: Team India batter Suryakumar Yadav bought a Mercedes Benz GLS worth around ₹2 crore ahead of Asia Cup 2022, which will begin in the UAE later this month. Earlier this year, Suryakumar had bought a Nissan 1 Ton Jonga. Suryakumar made his Team India debut in 2021 and has played 13 ODIs and 23 T20Is so far.

202.title: Jadeja has to prove his batting to replace Karthik, Pandya: Manjrekar
202.article_body: Former India cricketer Sanjay Manjrekar has commented on all-rounder Ravindra Jadeja's position in the India T20I team. "If Jadeja is going to be a batting all-rounder, then he has got to show that he is an adequate replacement to...Dinesh Karthik, who is likely to bat at number 6-7, or...Hardik Pandya," Manjrekar said.

203.title: Terrorists open fire at checkpoint in Kashmir, policeman injured
203.article_body: Terrorists opened fire at a security checkpoint in Anantnag, resulting in injuries to a Jammu and Kashmir policeman. The police have cordoned off the area and a search is underway for the attackers. The injured policeman, Ghulam Qadir, was immediately evacuated and is currently receiving treatment in a hospital, the Kashmir Police said in a tweet.

204.title: Valour of soldiers to be included in school textbooks: Education Minister
204.article_body: Tales of valour of Indian soldiers would soon be made part of the school textbooks, Union Education Minister Dharmendra Pradhan, said. "To strengthen the sense of responsibility towards the nation from an early age, the education ministry in consultation with the defence ministry will work to include the valour of our soldiers into the school curriculum," he said.

205.title: Terrorism suspect blows himself up in Saudi Arabia, 4 injured
205.article_body: A terrorism suspect detonated an explosive device in Saudi Arabia's Jeddah on Wednesday as security forces attempted to arrest him, killing himself and injuring four others, state media reported on Friday. The man has been identified as Abdullah bin Zaid Abdulrahman Al-Bakry Al-Shihry. He was wanted in connection with a deadly 2015 bombing in the country.

206.title: 'The Satanic Verses' author Salman Rushdie attacked during lecture in US
206.article_body: India-born author of 'The Satanic Verses', Salman Rushdie, was attacked on Friday as he was about to give a lecture at the Chautauqua Institution in New York, AP reported. A man stormed the stage Rushdie was on and punched or stabbed him during the author's introduction, AP said. Rushdie fell to the floor and his attacker was reportedly restrained.

207.title: Party will talk to Opposition to make Mamata PM candidate: TMC MP
207.article_body: Ahead of 2024 Lok Sabha polls, TMC MP Saugata Roy said his party will talk to others in the Opposition to make West Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee a joint prime ministerial candidate. "Mamata Banerjee is leading in this. She's backed by this huge state," Roy said. "Our workers definitely want Mamata as the PM candidate," Roy added.

208.title: Man tasked by Pak's Jaish terror group to kill Nupur Sharma arrested: UP Police
208.article_body: The Uttar Pradesh Anti-Terrorism Squad on Friday arrested terrorist Muhammad Nadeem from Saharanpur. According to the agency, the accused was allegedly in direct contact with Pakistan-based terrorist outfits Jaish-e-Mohammed (JeM) and Tehrik-e Taliban Pakistan (TTP). He was tasked by JeM to kill Nupur Sharma, who was suspended from the BJP over her controversial remarks on Prophet Muhammad.

209.title: 'Laal Singh Chaddha' gets 4.5/10 rating on IMDb with 55,000 1-star ratings
209.article_body: Aamir Khan's 'Laal Singh Chaddha' currently has a rating of 4.5/10 on IMDb with over 55,000 one-star ratings. As of 8:25 pm on Friday, as many as 89,577 IMDb users have rated the movie, with 55,819 (62.3%) giving one star to it. As many as 21,063 users have given 10/10, while 6,102 gave 9/10 and 3,111 users gave 8/10.

210.title: Please don't boycott 'Laal...', people have worked so hard on it: Kareena
210.article_body: Kareena Kapoor Khan in an interview requested people not to boycott her latest film 'Laal Singh Chaddha'. "Please don't boycott this film, because it's...like boycotting good cinema," she said, adding, "And people have worked so hard on it; we've had 250 people work on this film for two-and-a-half years." The film reportedly collected ₹12 crore on its opening day.

211.title: The Great Khali cries while posing for photographers, video leaves fans confused
211.article_body: A video has shown former WWE star Dalip Singh Rana aka The Great Khali suddenly crying while posing in front of photographers. Khali is seen walking toward the paparazzi waiting to photograph him and waving at them. He's then seen suddenly turning away from the cameras and wiping his eyes without saying anything, leaving fans confused.

212.title: Genelia is hilarious, I love watching her reels: Sonam Kapoor
212.article_body: Actress Sonam Kapoor Ahuja, during her appearance on Karan Johar's chat show 'Koffee With Karan', said that she likes the social media handle of Genelia Deshmukh. "I love watching her reels. She and Riteish (Deshmukh) are hilarious. I am constantly stalking her on social media," she said. Sonam appeared on 'Koffee With Karan' with Arjun Kapoor.

213.title: Developments from Bihar are encouraging to forge pro-people alternative: Raja
213.article_body: After meeting Bihar's Deputy CM Tejashwi Yadav in Delhi on Friday, the General Secretary of the Communist Party of India, D Raja, has commented on the recent political change in the state. "Developments from Bihar are encouraging to forge a secular-democratic unity & pro-people alternative to RSS-BJP's divisive politics before general elections in 2024," Raja tweeted.

214.title: Odisha CM Naveen Patnaik launches irrigation projects in Mayurbhanj
214.article_body: Odisha CM Naveen Patnaik on Friday launched Deo and Subarnarekha irrigation projects in Mayurbhanj district and also laid the foundation stone for many developmental projects on Friday. Both the irrigation projects are expected to benefit the people of Mayurbhanj and Balasore districts, the Chief Minister's office informed. The CM added that ₹685 crore were invested for the Subarnarekha project.

215.title: 12, including 4 Nepali nationals, injured as bus hits divider in UP
215.article_body: At least 12 people, including three Nepali passengers and the bus driver, who is from Nepal, were injured after their bus rammed into the divider on Agra-Lucknow Expressway on Friday, officials said. Three Nepali passengers, Manju Darai, Bhanubhakt and Priti Pandey sustained critical injuries, police said. The bus, carrying 35 passengers, was travelling from Pokhara in Nepal to Delhi.

216.title: 10 Bangladeshi nationals, including 2 children, deported from Assam
216.article_body: At least 10 Bangladeshi nationals, including two children, who were caught on charges of entering the country illegally were reportedly deported to Bangladesh from Assam's Karimganj border on Thursday. "After a joint agreement between the offices concerned in India and Bangladesh, these people were sent," Assam Police said. They were handed over to representatives of Border Guard Bangladesh (BGB).

217.title: US-made missile defence system not negotiable: South Korea to China
217.article_body: South Korea on Thursday said that a US-made missile defence system deployed by the country can never be subject to negotiations with China. This comment comes after China demanded that South Korea not deploy any more batteries and limit the use of existing ones. South Korea had announced the installation of Terminal High Altitude Area Defence (THAAD) system in 2016.

218.title: UP man wins 22-yr-old case against Railways over ₹20 extra fee, to get over ₹15,000
218.article_body: A UP man recently won a 22-year-old court case against Railways which he filed after being wrongly charged ₹20 extra due to a clerk's error in 1999. Tungnath Chaturvedi was charged ₹90 for two tickets whose actual fare totalled ₹70. Railways will pay him a ₹15,000 fine, plus ₹20 at a 12% interest for each year from 1999 to 2022.

219.title: As a Chadha, I wholeheartedly endorse 'Laal Singh Chaddha': Richa Chadha
219.article_body: Amid the calls to boycott Aamir Khan's 'Laal Singh Chaddha', actress Richa Chadha wrote on Twitter, "As a Chadha, I wholeheartedly endorse #LaalSinghChaddha." "[The film] made us laugh and cry in unison...excellent work by ALL," she added. The film, also starring Kareena Kapoor Khan and Naga Chaitanya, is a remake of the Hollywood film 'Forrest Gump'.

220.title: Had crispy aromatic duck night before my 1st WC match, got out on duck: Ross Taylor
220.article_body: Ex-New Zealand batter Ross Taylor, in his book, revealed he had a superstition of not eating duck before matches. He added that the night before his first-ever World Cup match in 2007, he had a crispy aromatic duck and he got out for a duck in that match. "Rule number one...Don't have duck the night before a game," he wrote.

221.title: Shubman Gill's selfie with ₹500 note inside phone cover goes viral, fans react
221.article_body: A mirror selfie of cricketer Shubman Gill, wherein a ₹500 note can be seen inside his phone cover, went viral. The photo was shared by Gill on Instagram after getting his hair styled from celebrity hairstylist Aalim Hakim. "500 is glowing," a user wrote. "He also keeps ₹500 note in phone cover...at least something is common between us," another wrote.

222.title: What are the 'freebies' provided to Chief Justice of India: Jayant
222.article_body: After a Supreme Court bench termed the distribution of freebies by political parties as a "serious issue", RLD President Jayant Chaudhary asked that "what are the 'freebies' provided to the Chief Justice of India?". "Recent remarks by the SC...are not in the right spirit! The bottom of the pyramid needs direct intervention whether in ration or...financial support," Chaudhary tweeted.

223.title: 12-year-old girl raped, body found near railway track in Faridabad
223.article_body: The body of a 12-year-old girl who was allegedly raped and murdered was found near a railway track in Faridabad, police said on Friday. The minor had gone out to defecate in the evening hours, police added. According to police, her body was found after her family launched a search for her when she did not return for an hour.

224.title: Vehicles submerged as water level of Pune's Mutha river rises
224.article_body: The water level of the Mutha river in Pune rose after water was released from the Khadakwasla Dam on Thursday, following which several vehicles on riverside roads were submerged. As per reports, police, along with local residents, helped remove the submerged vehicles. The IMD has issued a heavy-rainfall alert in the city for this week.

225.title: Flag march held as Hindu groups seek to conduct puja at B'luru's Idgah Maidan
225.article_body: The Karnataka Police on Friday carried out a flag march at Bengaluru's Idgah Maidan, after some Hindu groups expressed their wish to organise a puja on Ganesh Chaturthi. A row in this connection began when Hindu activists claimed that the ground is for the public and not a property of the Waqf Board.

226.title: Can't trust those who don't hoist Tricolour on I-Day: U'khand BJP chief
226.article_body: Uttarakhand BJP chief Mahendra Bhatt said people who don't hoist the Tricolour on their houses on Independence Day cannot be trusted. "It is only natural. After all, why should any Indian have problems in hoisting the Tricolour on their houses to celebrate the occasion?" he said. He later clarified that his remark was "meant only for party workers".

227.title: Mumbai Police team visits Ranveer Singh's house to issue summons over his nude pics
227.article_body: A team from Mumbai Police on Friday went to Ranveer Singh's residence to issue him summons in connection with an FIR against him for posting his nude photographs on Instagram. He was not at his residence and the police were told he would be back on August 16. The team will once again visit his residence to serve the summons.

228.title: BCCI mulling to organise 1st women's IPL in March 2023: Report
228.article_body: The BCCI is reportedly planning to hold the first edition of the women's IPL in the March 2023 window. According to a report, BCCI is keen on this window, especially after deciding to begin the women's domestic season in October instead of November. Notably, BCCI President Sourav Ganguly had earlier said that the board wants a full-fledged WIPL from 2023.

229.title: India urges Canada to ensure adequate security for its I-Day events
229.article_body: The Indian High Commission has urged the Canadian government to ensure adequate security arrangements for India's Independence Day celebrations at its missions across Canada, and for events organised by the Indo-Canadian community. There was information suggesting pro-Khalistan and pro-Pakistan Kashmiri groups were "planning to disrupt" such events, Indian officials cited by Hindustan Times said.

230.title: NIA arrests 9th accused in Kanhaiya Lal murder case
230.article_body: The National Investigation Agency (NIA) has arrested one Muslim Khan in connection with the murder of Udaipur-based tailor Kanhaiya Lal, officials said. The 41-year-old accused, a resident of Rajasthan's Pratapgarh, played an "active role" in the conspiracy, the agency said. This is the ninth arrest made by the NIA in the case since taking over the investigation on June 29.

231.title: Locals claim BBMP is selling faulty national flags in Bengaluru
231.article_body: Locals from Bengaluru took to Twitter to allege that civic body BBMP is selling faulty national flags in the city. RTI activist Veeresh Bellur said the size of some flags wasn't even and the Ashoka Chakra wasn't placed correctly in some flags. A BBMP official said 1-2% of the flags it received from Kannada and Culture Department had "minor issues".

232.title: 2 Shiv Sena party workers booked for 'defaming' PM Modi
232.article_body: Two Shiv Sena party workers have been booked for allegedly sharing morphed photographs of Prime Minister Narendra Modi and Home Minister Amit Shah with a derogatory message on social media. Both the accused reportedly belonged to the Yuva Sena. According to the police, while one of the accused shared the alleged post on social media, the other supported it.

233.title: 2 injured in attack by group in Delhi's Wazirabad
233.article_body: Two persons were injured after a group of 10 people attacked them in north Delhi's Wazirabad area, police said on Friday. Officials added that they received reports of shots being fired in the air in the area on Thursday night. The group was searching for one Deepak, after failing to find him it attacked passersby and damaged vehicles, police said.

234.title: Hatred was sown in society when BJP was in power: Bihar Dy CM Tejashwi
234.article_body: Bihar Deputy Chief Minister Tejashwi Yadav accused BJP of causing communal disharmony in the state and said "hatred was sown in the society" under BJP's rule. "Issues like Hindu-Muslim and Mandir-Masjid were only discussed when BJP was in power," he said. "Since we've formed the government, issues like employment and those related to youth's future are being addressed," Tejashwi said.

235.title: Ex-BJP MLA's wife gets 4-yr jail term for circulating fake currency
235.article_body: The second wife of ex-BJP MLA Putkar Hembrom has been sentenced to four years in jail by Jharkhand court for circulating fake currency. A fine of ₹5,000 was also imposed on her. Earlier, a woman from Matkamhatu village claimed Malaya Hembrom had given her a ₹2,000 note, which wasn't accepted by SBI. She claimed Malaya attacked her on being confronted.

236.title: Raju Srivastava hasn't regained consciousness in the last 46 hours, tweets Shekhar Suman
236.article_body: Comedian Raju Srivastava, who was admitted to Delhi's AIIMS on Wednesday following a heart attack, hasn't regained consciousness in the last 46 hours, tweeted Shekhar Suman on Friday. "Please all Indians pray hard for his recovery. We can't afford to lose this gem. I'm sure he is going to come back. God is great," Suman added.

237.title: Mumbai Indians-owned UAE franchise announce their squad
237.article_body: Mumbai Indians-owned MI Emirates today announced their squad for inaugural edition of UAE's International League T20. The squad includes veteran West Indian all-rounders Kieron Pollard and Dwayne Bravo. It also includes English batter Will Smeed, who recently became the first cricketer to slam a hundred in The Hundred. Local players from UAE will be added to squad later, MI said.

238.title: Go First B'luru-Maldives flight makes emergency landing as faulty alarm gets triggered
238.article_body: A Go First Bengaluru-Male (Maldives) flight with 92 passengers made an emergency landing at Coimbatore airport after an alarm went off, warning about engine overheating, officials said. The flight was checked and engineers found that the alarm was faulty, officials said. They said the flight was declared fit for takeoff and was scheduled to leave after 5 pm.

239.title: Hyderabad businessman cheated of ₹1 crore in crypto fraud
239.article_body: A businessman in Hyderabad was allegedly cheated of ₹1 crore by fraudsters after investing in cryptocurrency. Police said the victim was added to a WhatsApp group that had people interested in cryptocurrency and upon contacting the investment firm, he was asked to download two applications. "Lured by [initial] profits, he invested around ₹1 crore...through direct payment," police said.

240.title: It's ridiculous: 'Good...' maker on calls to boycott 'Laal...', 'Raksha...'
240.article_body: Siddharth Sen, director of Janhvi Kapoor-starrer 'Good Luck Jerry', has reacted to social media trends demanding a boycott of Akshay Kumar-starrer 'Raksha Bandhan' and Aamir Khan's 'Laal Singh Chaddha'. "It's ridiculous," he said, adding that people who're doing it have too much time. "You pull out an old tweet and say don't watch, I'm finding it very absurd," said Siddharth.

241.title: 'Laal Singh Chaddha' becomes Aamir Khan's lowest opener in 13 years
241.article_body: Aamir Khan-starrer 'Laal Singh Chaddha' collected ₹10.75 crore on its opening day, as per Box Office India. This is the actor's lowest opening in the last 13 years. His 2018 film 'Thugs of Hindostan' had opened at ₹52 crore. 'Laal Singh Chaddha' recorded the third biggest opening for a Hindi film in 2022 after 'Bhool Bhulaiyaa 2' and 'Bachchhan Paandey'.

242.title: BJP ruining schools & hospitals so people go to private ones: Sisodia
242.article_body: Delhi Deputy Chief Minister Manish Sisodia criticised the BJP for "making fun of welfare schemes" and accused them of following "Dostwaadi" model. "They [BJP] believe in ruining schools and hospitals to...extent that people are forced to go to private schools and hospitals which mostly belong to their friends," Sisodia said. "They don't believe in giving free...education to students," he said.

243.title: Punjab Cong MP's assistant attacked by over 12 people in Ludhiana
243.article_body: Punjab Congress MP Ravneet Singh Bittu's assistant Harjinder Singh Dhindsa was allegedly attacked by about 12 to 15 people in Ludhiana on Friday. Dhindsa was attacked with sharp-edged weapons and was rushed to a private hospital, police said. "He has multiple injuries on his body, including his head," Dr Bhagwan Singh, chairman of the hospital where Dhindsa was admitted, said.

244.title: Gurugram civic body forms 35 teams to enforce 9-day meat ban
244.article_body: The Municipal Corporation of Gurugram has set up 35 teams to ensure all meat shops under its limits remain closed during the Jain festival 'Paryushan Parv' from August 24 to September 1. In an earlier order, the municipality said the closure will affect 130 licensed meat shops. A penalty of ₹5,000 will be imposed on erring shops, an official said.

245.title: COVID positive burglar handcuffed to bed flees Kasturba hospital in Mumbai
245.article_body: A 22-year-old alleged burglar tested positive for COVID-19 and was admitted to Mumbai's Kasturba hospital. He was handcuffed to his bed in the COVID-19 ICU ward as police weren't allowed there to avoid infection. But, he somehow managed to escape through the hospital's toilet window. Police, however, caught him within 24 hours and brought him back to the same ward.

246.title: Global youth unemployment would decline to 7.3 cr in 2022, says UN
246.article_body: A UN report on Thursday said that the total global number of unemployed youths would decline to 7.3 crore in 2022, down by 20 lakh from the year before. However, this year's number is still 60 lakh higher than the pre-pandemic level of 2019, it added. The pandemic exacerbated the market challenges generally facing young people, it further said.

247.title: Priyanka, Nick not a good match, he looks so small in front of her: Sima
247.article_body: Sima Taparia of 'Indian Matchmaking' has said she doesn't think Priyanka Chopra and Nick Jonas are a good pair. "They have married, but it's not a good match. He looks so small and petite in front of her, and she looks elder," Sima said in an episode of the series. Priyanka and Nick have an age gap of 10 years.

248.title: Tejashwi Yadav to meet Sonia Gandhi in Delhi ahead of floor test
248.article_body: Bihar's new Deputy CM Tejashwi Yadav will meet Congress chief Sonia Gandhi in Delhi on Friday. This comes ahead of the August 24 floor test in the Bihar Assembly. After the RJD came back to power by aligning with rival Nitish Kumar's JDU, Tejashwi visited Delhi for Raksha Bandhan and to meet his father Lalu Prasad Yadav.

249.title: Over 77,000 seats vacant after 1st round of FYJC admissions in Pune
249.article_body: As many as 77,130 seats remained vacant after completion of the first regular round of admissions for first-year junior college (FYJC) or Class 11 in the Pune and Pimpri-Chinchwad regions. In the first round, only 31,700 students were admitted out of 1.03 lakh students who registered online for the admission process. The second round of admissions started on Friday.

250.title: 7-yr-old attacked by 2 fighting bulls dies due to head injuries in Noida
250.article_body: A seven-year-old girl, who was attacked by stray bulls in Noida's Salarpur, died due to severe head injuries, police said. The girl was passing by D K Water Supplier in Kalika Enclave in Salarpur on Thursday afternoon when the incident took place. She was reportedly caught in a fight between the two bulls in a narrow lane in the area.

251.title: Anti-encroachment notices put up in Gurugram's Sushant Lok 1 market
251.article_body: The Department of Town and Country Planning on Wednesday put up notices in Gurugram's Sushant Lok 1 market directing shop owners and market association to clear illegal encroachments. A demolition drive will be carried out if the encroachments are not removed voluntarily, an official said. Corrective actions were not taken by shop owners following an anti-encroachment drive earlier, he informed.

252.title: India concerned at recent developments: Govt amid China-Taiwan tensions
252.article_body: India is "concerned" about the recent developments in the Taiwan Strait where China and Taiwan recently conducted military exercises amid high tensions, the government has said. "We urge the exercise of restraint...de-escalation of tension and efforts to maintain peace and stability," said MEA spokesperson Arindam Bagchi. Tensions began over the US House of Representatives Nancy Pelosi's visit.

253.title: 1,300 shows of 'Laal Singh...' reduced by exhibitors after low turnout: Report
253.article_body: Exhibitors have voluntarily reduced shows of both 'Laal Singh Chaddha' and 'Raksha Bandhan' due to low turnout, said a report. While approximately 1,300 shows of 'Laal Singh Chaddha' have been reduced, 'Raksha Bandhan' has seen a reduction of 1,000 shows across the country, it added. The films reportedly failed to earn a combined total of ₹20 crore on opening day.

254.title: Massive portion of flyover on Shimla-Kalka highway collapses, 2 cars fall off
254.article_body: A video has gone viral showing a massive portion of flyover on Shimla-Kalka highway having collapsed. The collapse occurred after heavy rains in the area. In the video, two cars can be seen damaged after falling off the flyover. Further, trucks and other vehicles on the highway can be seen slowly reversing to get to safety.

255.title: Retail inflation eases to 6.71% in July from 7.01% in June, lowest since March
255.article_body: The country’s retail inflation, which is measured by the Consumer Price Index (CPI), eased to 6.71% in the month of July from 7.01% in June. It is the lowest since March, when CPI was recorded to be 6.95%. In May, it stood at 7.04% and in April it had hit an eight-year-high of 7.79%.

256.title: Solar storm causes purple-green aurora to appear in Canada, pics surface
256.article_body: Unusual streaks of purple-green lights were seen in Canadian skies recently after a solar storm hit the Earth. Pictures of the aurora or northern lights were shared by astronomy author and photographer Alan Dyer, who said they were visible for about 40 minutes. The lights were seen due to a rare phenomenon called Strong Thermal Emission Velocity Enhancement or STEVE.

257.title: 'Jungle raj' has returned to Bihar: BJP on RJD-JD(U) alliance
257.article_body: After the RJD-JD(U) government assumed power in Bihar, BJP on Friday cited several crimes since the alliance formed and alleged that 'jungle raj' has returned to Bihar. "Disorder is spreading in the state at a fast pace," BJP spokesperson Sambit Patra said. He claimed that BJP's presence in the state government earlier worked as a restraining influence on crime.

258.title: Hyd police buildings illuminated with Tricolour lights; pics emerge
258.article_body: All police buildings in Hyderabad have been illuminated with Tricolour lights ahead of the 75th Independence Day, Commissioner of Police CV Anand said. Hyderabad City Police shared pictures of the Commissioner's office and Telangana State Police Integrated Command and Control Center decorated with Tricolour lights. A picture of the illuminated Jubilee Hills Police Station was shared by its SHO.

259.title: Kerala Guv's interventions in govt matters weaken democratic process: CPI(M)
259.article_body: The CPI(M) Kerala Secretary Kodiyeri Balakrishnan has said that state Governor Arif Mohammed Khan's interventions in state government matters would weaken the democratic process. "The governor (Khan) is meddling in [govt] matters in an undemocratic manner. The government and governor should work together as two constitutional bodies but the act of the governor does not reflect it," Kodiyeri said.

260.title: Pit bull seriously injures domestic help in Gurugram, FIR filed
260.article_body: A domestic help working in Gurugram was mauled by a pit bull leaving her with serious injuries on her head and face, police said. An FIR has been filed after the victim's family claimed the pit bull was let loose from its leash during its morning walk. The dog allegedly knocked the 30-year-old woman down and bit her all over.

261.title: 1st Agnipath recruitment rally for Pune zone to be held on Aug 13
261.article_body: The first Agnipath Army recruitment rally for the Pune Recruiting Zone will begin on Saturday in Aurangabad. In total, eight recruitment rallies will be held for the Pune Recruiting Zone, including one rally for Agniveer Women Military Police. "The response for the Agnipath scheme has been enthusiastic and the youth have registered adequately," the Army said in a statement.

262.title: Sri Lanka's ex-President Gotabaya Rajapaksa arrives in Thailand
262.article_body: Sri Lanka's former President Gotabaya Rajapaksa on Thursday arrived in Thailand, where he is expected to stay temporarily. Rajapaksa had arrived at Bangkok's Don Mueang International Airport on a chartered flight from Singapore. Notably, Rajapaksa, who holds a diplomatic passport, has made no public appearances or comments since fleeing Sri Lanka last month amid mass protests.

263.title: National Award-winning singer Shivamogga Subbanna dies of heart attack at 83
263.article_body: National Award-winning singer Shivamogga Subbanna passed away on Thursday night at a hospital in Bengaluru following a heart attack. He was 83. Shivamogga won a National Award for the song, 'Kaadu Kudure Odi Banditta' from the film 'Kaadu Kudure'. He was the first Kannadiga to win a National Award for playback singing.

264.title: Trump calls for 'immediate' release of FBI warrant used to search his home
264.article_body: Former US President Donald Trump called for the "immediate" release of the warrant the FBI used to search his Florida home this week. This came hours after US Justice Department asked a court to unseal the warrant. The search was part of an investigation into whether Trump illegally removed records from White House as he left office in January 2021.

265.title: Man drowns in Mumbai's Mahim creek, body recovered; another feared dead
265.article_body:
A 28-year-old man drowned in Mumbai's Mahim creek and his body was recovered on Friday morning, while another person accompanying him was feared dead, officials said. The fire brigade was alerted after two men had gone missing from Mahim causeway on Thursday night.
"The body of Javed Alam Shaikh...was found floating in the creek near...Reclamation flyover bridge," the official said.

266.title: Rupee closes 4 paise lower at 79.66 against US dollar
266.article_body: The rupee fell 4 paise to close at 79.66 (provisional) against the US dollar on Friday amid rising crude oil prices and a strong dollar. At the interbank foreign exchange market, the rupee opened at 79.67 and saw an intra-day high of 79.63 and a low of 79.72 against the dollar. The dollar index rose 0.26% to 105.36.

267.title: Sussanne, Bobby attend Arjun Kanungo-Carla's wedding reception, pics surface
267.article_body: The wedding reception of newly-married couple, singer Arjun Kanungo and South African model Carla Dennis on Thursday was attended by several celebrities from the film industry. The guests included Sussanne Khan, Arslan Goni, Bobby Deol, Tanya Deol, Kubbra Sait and many others. Arjun and Carla got married on August 10 in Mumbai.

268.title: Alliance with Shiv Sena is not permanent: Congress' Nana Patole
268.article_body: Commenting on ties with Shiv Sena, Congress leader Nana Patole said, "We had an alliance with them in a different situation. This is not our natural or permanent alliance." He also commented on the Eknath Shinde and Devendra Fadnavis-led new government and alleged that it was formed using central agencies and funds.

269.title: Mob attacks 2 in Delhi after they fail to find man they were looking for
269.article_body: A video showing a group of around 10 people attacking two persons after they failed to find a man they were looking for in Delhi's Wazirabad on Thursday has surfaced online. According to the police, they were searching for a man named Deepak. When they failed to find him, they attacked two passers-by, Jatin (17) and Ajay (42), injuring them.

270.title: Man arrested for dowry death after wife dies by suicide in Gurugram
270.article_body: A man has been arrested on dowry death charge after his 19-year-old wife allegedly died by suicide in Gurugram's Chandu village on Tuesday, police informed on Friday. According to police, a case of murder was initially registered against the accused following a complaint by deceased's family. However, probe later revealed that the woman died by suicide, an officer told media.

271.title: Man takes hostages at bank in bid to get his trapped money in crisis-hit Lebanon
271.article_body: A man entered a bank in crisis-hit Lebanon's Beirut and held at least 10 people hostage demanding access to his own trapped money, according to The Washington Post. A video showing police trying to calm the man down surfaced on social media. The man, who had about $200,000 stuck in the bank, surrendered after a seven-hour-long standoff.

272.title: Karnataka HC abolishes Anti Corruption Bureau, cases transferred to Lokayukta
272.article_body: The Karnataka HC abolished the Anti Corruption Bureau (ACB) formed by the then Congress state government in 2016 and transferred all the pending cases to the Lokayukta Police division. "If really the government intends to curb corruption, favouritism and official indiscipline in administration machinery, the ACB should have been allowed to work under the control of Lokayukta," the court said.

273.title: 3 die after inhaling poisonous gas inside well in MP's Sagar
273.article_body: Three people died after inhaling a poisonous gas on entering a well in Madhya Pradesh's Sagar district on Thursday evening, police said. The victims reportedly entered the 60-feet-deep well to remove a motor, but inhaled some poisonous gas emanating from it, following which they fell unconscious and drowned. They were aged between 25 and 65 years, an official said.

274.title: Akshay's fans dance in theatre during 'Raksha Bandhan' show, video surfaces
274.article_body: A video showing fans of Akshay Kumar dancing in a theatre during the screening of 'Raksha Bandhan' has surfaced online. In the video, people could be seen dancing in front of the screen while a song from the film played in the background. The Aanand L Rai directorial collected ₹8.20 crore on Thursday, according to film trade analyst Taran Adarsh.

275.title: BJP didn't follow 'coalition dharma': JD(U) leader Lalan Singh
275.article_body: JD(U) leader Lalan Singh accused BJP of violating "coalition dharma" by trying to sabotage his party. He said that CM Nitish Kumar was under pressure from his own party members to pull out of the alliance. "The present BJP leadership should tell how many NDA allies are still left in the alliance as compared to 2014," Singh further said.

276.title: Somalia’s worst drought in 40 years displaces 1 million people
276.article_body: A "devastating drought" in Somalia has internally displaced one million people since the dry conditions struck in January, the UN refugee agency, UNHCR, said. "Somalia is going through a two-year historic dry spell, the likes of which haven't been seen in over 40 years," UNHCR said, adding, "An expected fifth failed rainy season is set to displace many more families."

277.title: 'Chor, chor' slogans raised as CBI produces Anubrata Mondal in court
277.article_body: Several people shouted slogans of 'chor, chor' while the Central Bureau of Investigation produced TMC leader Anubrata Mondal in a special court on Thursday in connection with cattle smuggling case, reports said. Reports added that people also showed shoes to the TMC leader. Meanwhile, Mondal was on Thursday sent to the CBI custody till August 20 by the Asansol court.

278.title: Rly police recover body packed in gunny bag from train in Bihar
278.article_body: Railway police have recovered a burnt body that was packed inside a gunny bag, which they found lying beside a toilet, from a passenger train in Bihar's Katihar on Thursday. "The man...was first killed and then his face was burnt with acid to hide his identity," an official said. The body was found after passengers complained about a foul smell.

279.title: B'luru Metro fare from Lalbagh station to cost ₹30 from August 13 to 15
279.article_body: The Bangalore Metro Rail Corporation Limited (BMRCL) has announced a paper ticket system which will cost ₹30 to all stations from Lalbagh metro station. The tickets will be issued from August 13-15 and will be valid for a single trip, BMRCL said. The move will encourage people visiting  Independence Day Flower Show at Lalbagh Botanical Garden to use public transport.

280.title: Fire tornado caught on camera amid massive blaze in US, video released
280.article_body: Aerial footage of a fire tornado or a 'firenado' that formed amid a massive wildfire in US' California has been released online. The 'firenado' was spotted amid a brush fire that erupted on Wednesday in Gorman and spread to around 150 acres. Around 200 firefighters were called to fight the massive blaze.

281.title: I'm glad she said what she thought: Vijay on Ananya criticising 'Arjun Reddy'
281.article_body: On being asked about Ananya Panday's criticism of 'Arjun Reddy', actor Vijay Deverakonda said he is glad that she said what she thought. "I might not agree or disagree or I might even see both sides of the coin but it's okay," he added. Ananya had said that she won't accept the behaviours portrayed in the film in real life.

282.title: Manushi Chhillar was the first choice for 'Laal Singh Chaddha': Report
282.article_body: Actress Manushi Chhillar was the first choice for the role of Rupa in Aamir Khan-starrer 'Laal Singh Chaddha', reported Bollywood Hungama. As per the report, the actress turned it down due to her contract with Yash Raj Films and made her debut in 'Samrat Prithviraj' opposite Akshay Kumar. The role of Rupa is portrayed by Kareena Kapoor.

283.title: 'Tiranga shikara rally' organised at Dal Lake in Srinagar
283.article_body: The Youth Services and Sports Department of Jammu and Kashmir organised a 'Tiranga shikara rally' at Dal Lake in Srinagar ahead of Independence Day. The rally was flagged off by Lieutenant Governor Manoj Sinha under the 'Har Ghar Tiranga' campaign. The campaign aims to encourage every citizen to bring home the National Flag and hoist it with pride.

284.title: Over 2 lakh PACS needed to meet agri-finance target: Amit Shah
284.article_body: Home and Cooperation Minister Amit Shah said that more than 2 lakh new primary agriculture credit societies (PACS) are needed across the country to meet the target of providing agri-finance worth ₹10 lakh crore through cooperatives. At a national conference on rural cooperative banks on Friday, he said that there are over 95,000 PACS, however, only about 63,000 are functional.

285.title: Allu Arjun's slipper step in 'Srivalli' was actually a mistake: Big B
285.article_body: Veteran actor Amitabh Bachchan has revealed that actor Allu Arjun's step with his slipper in the song 'Srivalli' was actually a mistake. The actor said that Sukumar, who directed the film 'Pushpa: The Rise', told him while he was shooting in Hyderabad that Allu Arjun missed his slipper and it became a step. The film collected over ₹360 crore worldwide.

286.title: Can find replacement for Kohli, Rohit but not Hardik: Aakash on T20Is
286.article_body: Ex-India opener Aakash Chopra said Team India "can find a replacement" for Virat Kohli, Rohit Sharma and Jasprit Bumrah in their T20I lineup for tournaments like Asia Cup and T20 World Cup 2022. "But if Hardik Pandya's not there, you cannot make that XI," added Aakash. "Hardik's the only player in the squad who is providing that balance," he stated.

287.title: Mumbai Police wrongly list Haryana man's number as senior inspector
287.article_body: Mumbai Police allegedly uploaded a Haryana man's mobile number on their website mistakenly as that of the senior police inspector of the Agripada PS. The 37-year-old Sanjay Dagar reportedly received 50-70 calls daily which included complaints about molestation or tip-offs from police sources. However, the Mumbai Police have said that they will check the contact details on their website soon.

288.title: Perseid meteor shower expected to peak tonight, NASA reveals when and where to spot it
288.article_body: The Perseid meteor shower is expected to peak late Friday night into early Saturday morning. "If you do decide to look for these meteors, the best time should be after midnight...You'll need to be far from...city...in a place with no clouds...and have...clear view of...large expanse of sky. You'll need to look northward away from the glow of...Moon," said NASA.

289.title: BMC to set up 9 mini waste-to-energy plants in Mumbai
289.article_body: The Brihanmumbai Municipal Corporation (BMC) is setting up nine mini waste-to-energy or biomethanisation plants across Mumbai with the capacity to process two metric tonnes (MT) of organic waste per day. Currently, three mini waste-to-energy plants are operational. "Wards have been directed to find suitable plots in their jurisdiction to set up...nine biomethanisation plants," an official said.

290.title: Ex-German Chancellor sues Parliament over stripped privileges: Report
290.article_body: Former German Chancellor Gerhard Schröder has sued the German Parliament, Bundestag, in a bid to restore special privileges he was stripped of in May, German news agency DPA reported on Friday. The Parliament had taken away some of Schröder's special rights and privileges for refusing to cut ties with Russian President Vladimir Putin following Moscow's invasion of Ukraine.

291.title: Don't be so shameless: Tejashwi Yadav to Giriraj over his tweet
291.article_body: Bihar Deputy CM Tejashwi Yadav criticised Union Minister Giriraj Singh over his tweet in which Singh taunted Yadav for being unable to fulfil his promise of providing one million jobs. Yadav said, "Sir, don't be so shameless...This is the plight of the BJP. Only because of these idiotic antics, edited videos...,these poor people have no face in Bihar."

292.title: SC directs states to file affidavits on Haj Committees within 2 weeks
292.article_body: Supreme Court on Friday directed the state governments to file affidavits on Haj Committees within two weeks. SC has asked the states to inform it on whether Haj Committees have been constituted and to specify the names of committee members. This comes after a petition claimed that many states have not filed compliance reports under the Haj Committee Act, 2002.

293.title: Cyberabad Police solve double murder of migrant workers, 1 held
293.article_body: A migrant worker from Jharkhand, Bhuvaneswar Singh, was arrested by Cyberabad Police for allegedly murdering two migrant workers from Jharkhand. Police said Singh was arrested from his relatives' house in Jharkhand, where he was hiding. The case was initially suspected to be an accidental gas leak, but after 17 days of probe, the police arrested Singh, who confessed during questioning.

294.title: Tie-up with Nitish Kumar's JD(U) 'natural alliance, not deal': Tejashwi
294.article_body: Bihar Deputy CM Tejashwi Yadav on Thursday said the tie-up between CM Nitish Kumar's JD(U) and 'Mahagathbandhan' is a "natural alliance and not a deal". "This is...real 'Mahagathbandhan' which was formed by Lalu Yadav...and Nitish Kumar. We welcomed Nitish Kumar's decision and came together," Tejashwi added. He further said within one month Bihar will be the single-largest job providing state.

295.title: 'Thor 4' came out of nowhere, did 400 push ups on day of my shot: Brett
295.article_body: Brett Goldstein, who portrayed Hercules in the post-credits scene of 'Thor: Love and Thunder', said that the offer came "out of nowhere". Brett said he was given two weeks to prepare and told director Taika Waititi that he's "basically...a skinny comedian". "I'm doing 400 push-ups that day. I was fit to explode. I did the best I could," he added.

296.title: 9-year-old girl who disliked school dies by suicide in Hyd: Report
296.article_body: A nine-year-old girl allegedly died by suicide in Begumpet, Hyderabad, on Thursday as she disliked attending school, a report said. Police said the class five student of a private school had skipped classes for six days. She reportedly hanged herself in her house while her six-year-old brother watched. The incident happened after her mother, a domestic worker, left for work.

297.title: Politics should be kept away from sports: Robert Vadra
297.article_body: Reacting to the row over Aam Aadmi Party denying a cash reward to wrestler Divya Kakran, Priyanka Gandhi's husband Robert Vadra said that politics should not be brought into sports. "I think we should be proud of them as Indians holistically and we should help them. It's not that the Delhi government has to help only Delhi sportspersons," said Vadra.

298.title: Hacker offers to sell data of Shanghai's COVID app's 48.5 mn users
298.article_body: A hacker, who goes by the username "XJP", has claimed to have access to the personal information of the users of Shanghai's COVID-19 health code mobile app. The hacker posted an offer on Breach Forums to sell the data of 48.5 million users for $4,000. XJP also gave a sample of the data, including the details of 47 users.

299.title: Why aren't AAP MLAs' kids studying in Delhi govt schools?: Joshi
299.article_body: Union Minister Pralhad Joshi has criticised Delhi CM and AAP chief Arvind Kejriwal, calling him a "liar". "[Kejriwal has] promised free electricity in many states. What has he provided in Delhi? Questions have been raised," he said. He also questioned why the children of AAP MLAs aren't studying in the national capital's government schools if the schools are functioning well.

300.title: Hong Kong reports record decline in population amid COVID curbs
300.article_body: Hong Kong on Thursday reported a record decline in its population as COVID-19 curbs hampered the inflow of new workers and births declined. The city saw a decline of 1,21,500 residents in the year ended June 30, leaving the population at about 72.9 lakh. The death rate has risen gradually due to the ageing of the population, the government said.

301.title: Britain's economy drops by 0.1% in Q2 amid fears over recession
301.article_body: Britain's economy contracted in the second quarter with the GDP dropping 0.1% in the April-June period. It had witnessed a rise of 0.8% in the first quarter, the Office for National Statistics (ONS) said on Friday. The UK economy fell 0.6% in June, the ONS added. The Bank of England expects the economy to fall into recession this year.

302.title: 25-yr-old man stabbed to death in crowded Malviya Nagar market in Delhi; video surfaces
302.article_body: A 25-year-old man was stabbed to death by a group of four-five men in a crowded market in South Delhi's Malviya Nagar area, police said. A video of the incident has surfaced online, showing the accused men chasing the victim before stabbing him multiple times as onlookers watched. Police said they have filed an FIR.

303.title: Man rapes business partner at 5-star Bengaluru hotel after calling her for meeting
303.article_body: A man raped his business partner at a 5-star hotel in Bengaluru after calling her for a meeting on August 6, police said. The accused, who hails from Tamil Nadu, is absconding, police further said. The police added that an FIR was registered on August 10 and that teams have been deployed to trace the accused.

304.title: Crimea blasts degrade Russia’s Black Sea air fleet: UK
304.article_body: Blasts at the Russian-operated Saky military airfield in Crimea this week have "degraded" its navy's Black Sea aviation fleet, UK's Defence Ministry said, adding Russia has lost eight fighter jets. The lost jets are only a fraction of the overall aviation fleet, but it'll be a "significant" setback since Saky is used as a primary operational base, it added.

305.title: 2 foetuses found dumped in Madhya Pradesh's Bhopal; probe underway
305.article_body: Two foetuses were found dumped in different areas of Madhya Pradesh's Bhopal, police said on Friday. While one foetus was found floating in a drain in front of Sultania Hospital three days ago, another was found in a puddle under Katara Hills police station area two days ago. Both foetuses were sent to ascertain their age, police said.

306.title: Double-decker bus hits divider, falls into gorge in UP; 36 injured
306.article_body: At least 36 passengers have been injured after a double-decker bus fell into a gorge in Uttar Pradesh's Firozabad after hitting the divider on Agra-Lucknow Expressway on Friday, officials said. All passengers were taken to a hospital and 28 of the injured were hospitalised while the rest were discharged after first aid, officials added. The incident occurred around 1 am.

307.title: TMC to hold protests over leader Anubrata's arrest in cattle smuggling scam
307.article_body: After CBI arrested TMC leader Anubrata Mondal in connection with cattle smuggling scam, the party has announced to hold two-day protests from Friday against the alleged misuse of power. "Agencies should treat all suspects equally. No move has been made against BJP’s Suvendu Adhikari in the Saradha and Narada cases although he is an accused," said Bengal minister Chandrima Bhattacharya.

308.title: 3 sandalwood trees stolen from cantonment area in Pune's Wanowrie
308.article_body: Three sandalwood trees were reportedly axed and stolen from bungalow number 5 located on the Right Flank Road behind Command Hospital in the cantonment area of Pune's Wanowrie on August 5. In his FIR, the 62-year-old bungalow owner, Dilip Chavan, alleged that two of the stolen trees were between 8-10 feet in height, and the other was 5-7 feet tall.

309.title: UGC proposes to merge NEET, JEE exams into Common University Entrance Test
309.article_body: UGC Chairman Professor M Jagadesh Kumar said the Commission has proposed to merge the medical/dental entrance exam NEET and engineering entrance exam JEE into the Common University Entrance Test (CUET). The proposal's aim is to not subject students to the "stress" of multiple entrance tests based on the same knowledge base, the Times of India quoted Kumar as saying.

310.title: DCW chair sends rakhi to Jaishankar, seeks justice for Mandeep Kaur
310.article_body: Delhi Commission for Women (DCW) Chairperson Swati Maliwal sent a rakhi to External Affairs Minister S Jaishankar on Thursday. She also sent him a letter seeking justice for Mandeep Kaur, who died by suicide in America allegedly over domestic abuse. On behalf of DCW, Maliwal urged the minister to help bring Kaur's mortal remains back to her family in India.

311.title: OnePlus 10T with 16GB RAM to go on sale on August 16
311.article_body: OnePlus has announced the sale of the OnePlus 10T 16GB RAM variant starting from August 16. The phone features the signature 150W SUPERVOOC Endurance Edition charging, 50 MP triple camera, Snapdragon 8+ Gen 1 chipset and 256GB UFS 3.1 storage. Users can buy the smartphone for the price of ₹55,999.

312.title: People exposed to COVID-19 no longer need to quarantine: US CDC
312.article_body: The US Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC) said that it is no longer recommending that adults and children quarantine after having been exposed to COVID-19. The CDC added that it was also dropping its "test-to-stay" policy, which required students exposed to the virus to take regular tests to remain in the classroom or in childcare settings.

313.title: 2 killed, 6 injured in communal clashes in K'taka's Koppal; 25 held
313.article_body: Two people were killed and six others injured after clashes broke out between two communities in Karnataka's Koppal on Thursday. "More than 25 people were taken into custody in Hulihyder village [in connection with] the violence which occurred at the time of Muharram," Koppal SP said. Police have asked authorities to impose Section 144 for seven days, the SP added.

314.title: Jahangirpuri violence accused gets interim bail for wife's delivery
314.article_body: A Delhi court granted interim bail for one week to an accused in the Jahangirpuri violence case as his wife is due for delivery on August 22. "He may flee away...situation in the area is still charged up...applicant's release may again flare up the situation," the prosecution said. Communal clashes broke out in Jahangirpuri during a procession in April.

315.title: Google fined $43 mn for misleading users about location data in Aus
315.article_body: Google has been fined nearly $43 million in Australia for misleading users about collection of personal location data on Android phones. Google made it seem that it can only collect location data via 'Location History' setting, when 'Web & App Activity' setting allowed it to do the same. Australian Competition & Consumer Commission filed a case against Google in 2019.

316.title: MD of BYJU'S-owned Aakash buys Delhi bungalow worth ₹137 crore: Report
316.article_body: Aakash Chaudhry, the Managing Director of Aakash Educational Services Limited, has bought a bungalow worth ₹137 crore in Delhi's Chanakyapuri area, documents accessed by Zapkey.com showed. Chaudhry paid a stamp duty of ₹8.2 crore for the 1,293 square metre property. This is the third high value property bought by Chaudhry family after BYJU'S acquired Aakash for $950 million last year.

317.title: Story that inspired us all: Sidharth marks one year of 'Shershaah'
317.article_body: Actor Sidharth Malhotra on Friday took to social media to mark one year since the release of his film 'Shershaah'. Sharing a video montage, the actor wrote, "One film, one year, one story that inspired us all! Your love, support & appreciation for this film has said enough." He further wrote, "#1YearOfShershaah aur "yeh dil maange more!""

318.title: Government issues flood warning for Yamuna river in Delhi
318.article_body: Central Water Commission has issued a flood warning for the Yamuna river in Delhi. Over 3,00,000 cusecs of water has been reportedly released into the Yamuna from Hathnikund Barrage in Haryana's Yamunanagar. The present level at the Old Railway Bridge, the benchmark for assessing the flood situation in Delhi, is 204.29 m, while the danger mark is 205.33 m.

319.title: Instagram can track everything users do on iOS via in-app browser: Google ex-engineer
319.article_body: Instagram and Facebook can track a user's web activity through the in-app browser on their iOS apps, according to a former Google engineer's research. The apps open all external links in an in-app browser, allowing them to monitor everything a user does without any consent, said Felix Krause. He claimed that tracked data included passwords, addresses and credit card numbers.

320.title: Those who can't cook find flaws in dish: 'Laal...' actor on low opening
320.article_body: Reacting to 'Laal Singh Chaddha' recording Aamir Khan's lowest opening in last 13 years as per Box Office India, the film's actor Harry Parmar said, "Those who cannot cook...easily point out flaws in a dish." "Please see the effort behind making a film. It takes extreme man-hours, a thousand hours of creative process and a lot of money," added Harry.

321.title: India Maharajas to face World XI in match to mark 75 years of independence, teams out
321.article_body: India Maharajas will face World Giants in a special Legends League Cricket match on September 16 to celebrate India's 75 years of independence. India Maharajas will be led by Sourav Ganguly, while World Giants will be captained by Eoin Morgan. The match will take place at Eden Gardens in Kolkata. India's squad also includes Virender Sehwag and Harbhajan Singh.

322.title: Govt issues clarification as reports claim tenants will pay 18% GST on house rent
322.article_body: The government on Friday issued a clarification as reports said that tenants would have to pay 18% GST on house rent. "Renting of a residential unit (is) taxable only when it is rented to a business entity," clarified the government. It added that properties rented to private or business persons for personal use and residence would not attract any GST.

323.title: Russell shares screenshot of Simmons 'beg' remark, says 'I am going to stay quiet'
323.article_body: All-rounder Andre Russell took to Instagram to share a screenshot of a news article wherein West Indies head coach Phil Simmons had stated that he won't beg players to play for West Indies. "I know this was coming but I am going to stay quiet!" Russell wrote. The article had stated that Russell hasn't made himself available for selection.

324.title: Can't kiss her goodbye, Indian govt considers me a criminal: Leena on grandmother's death
324.article_body: Filmmaker Leena Manimekalai, who faces FIRs over a film poster wherein goddess Kali is shown smoking, shared news of her grandmother's death and described how she couldn't "kiss her a goodbye". "I'm stuck in Toronto because I'm a 'criminal' according to Indian Government," she stated. "I don't understand why I'm alive when I can't even kiss her...farewell," Leena added.

325.title: TMC workers who were with Mamata to loot, murder will be abandoned: Malviya
325.article_body: Bharatiya Janata Party leader Amit Malviya said West Bengal Chief Minister Mamata Banerjee stopped picking calls from Partha Chatterjee and Anubrata Mondal after investigation against them by the central agencies. "Message for other ministers, TMC workers and bureaucrats, who have colluded with her to loot, murder and rape - you too will be abandoned," he wrote on Twitter.

326.title: Microsoft told 200 staff to 'find another position in 60 days or take severance': Report
326.article_body: Microsoft has reportedly laid off around 200 employees from its Modern Life Experiences team, which focuses on winning back consumers. According to Business Insider, Microsoft asked the affected employees to either find another position at the company within 60 days or take severance pay. The layoffs come weeks after Microsoft cut about 1% of its 180,000-person workforce in July.

327.title: Adani Group to invest ₹57,575 crore in two projects in Odisha
327.article_body: The Adani Group will invest ₹57,575 crore to set up two projects, an alumina refinery and an iron ore project, in Odisha. Chief Minister Naveen Patnaik-headed High-Level Clearance Authority of Odisha approved the projects that are expected to create 9,300 direct jobs. The alumina refinery will be set up near potential bauxite reserves or operational mines.

328.title: Thousands rally in Brazil in ‘defence of democracy’ ahead of Prez polls
328.article_body: Thousands of people took to the streets in Brazil on Thursday in "defence of democracy". The protests come amid attacks by President Jair Bolsonaro on the country's voting system that have raised fears that he could reject the results of October's Presidential election. Protesters were seen carrying banners like "Respect the vote, respect the people" and chanting "Out with Bolsonaro".

329.title: 8-yr-old girl raped by Panchayat head's husband in J'khand's Giridih
329.article_body: An eight-year-old girl was allegedly raped by the husband of a Panchayat head in Jharkhand's Giridih district on Thursday afternoon, police said. The incident reportedly occurred when the girl had gone to local Panchayat head Kanchan Devi's home to handover her soap. The police have formed three teams to arrest the accused who has gone missing after the incident.

330.title: Anne Heche not expected to survive: Family after actress crashes car into US home
330.article_body: Actress Anne Heche, who was hospitalised after crashing her car into a home in US' Los Angeles, has suffered a severe anoxic brain injury and is not expected to survive, her family spokesperson has said. The 53-year-old has been in coma after the crash last week and allegedly had drugs in her system. She has been kept on life support.

331.title: Anne Heche was under influence of cocaine during car crash: Report
331.article_body: Actress Anne Heche, who is critical after crashing her car into a house in Los Angeles, was under the influence of cocaine during the accident, reported TMZ. The report added that cocaine and fentanyl were found in her system but the fentanyl could have been present due to the pain medication provided at the hospital. The accident occurred last Friday.

332.title: Team should revolve around Suryakumar, he doesn't need to be slotted: Rohan
332.article_body: Reacting to former selector Saba Karim stating that Suryakumar Yadav can be slotted at number four in India's T20I team, cricketer-turned-commentator Rohan Gavaskar said, "Suryakumar doesn't need to be slotted...This...team needs to revolve around him." "You've got to figure out where is the best you can get out of him," added Rohan. Rohan stated that certain spots are however "non-negotiable".

333.title: Paytm shares fall after advisory firm opposes CEO's reappointment
333.article_body: Paytm shares fell by 6.2% on Friday after the Institutional Investor Advisory Services India advised shareholders to vote against the reappointment of Vijay Shekhar Sharma as the CEO of Paytm's parent One97 Communications. The RBI's new guidelines for digital lending apps also drove the shares to decline as this could operationally impact its buy-now-pay-later business, Paytm told investors.

334.title: Man hides ₹43 lakh-gold in undergarment, held at airport in K'taka
334.article_body: Customs officials have seized gold worth over ₹43 lakh from a male passenger at Mangaluru International Airport in Karnataka. The man had put the gold, which was in paste form, in a white adhesive tape pouch and hidden it inside a stitched pocket of the undergarment that he was wearing, officials said. The accused had arrived from Dubai on Wednesday.

335.title: No parking at Delhi Metro stations from 6 am on Aug 14 till 2 pm on Aug 15
335.article_body: Delhi Metro Rail Corporation (DMRC) said that in view of the security measures for Independence Day, parking facilities will not be available at Metro stations from 6 am on August 14 till 2 pm on August 15. Metro train services will continue to run as per normal schedule, DMRC added. Notably, 2,000 live cartridges were recovered in Delhi on Friday.

336.title: Playing a mom won't take away my mojo, but I'd play my age: Mini Mathur
336.article_body: Actress Mini Mathur said that she doesn't know why there is "a strange backfooted attitude" about playing a mother onscreen, adding that it won't "take away [her] mojo". Mini further said being "someone's mother" is not enough and wants to do roles appropriate for her. "I would ask them to cast me for the age that I am," she added.

337.title: Xiaomi unveils humanoid robot prototype worth ₹82 lakh that can read human emotions
337.article_body: Xiaomi has unveiled a humanoid robot prototype, called CyberOne, which has the ability to read human emotions. It has a face in the form of a curved OLED panel and is equipped with two cameras, allowing it to perceive the world in 3D and recognise individuals. The 177-cm tall robot will cost somewhere between ₹71 lakh and ₹82 lakh.

338.title: I have no aspirations of becoming Opposition's PM face in 2024: Nitish Kumar
338.article_body: After being sworn in as Bihar Chief Minister for a record eighth time, Janata Dal (United) leader Nitish Kumar on Friday said that he has no aspirations of becoming the Opposition's PM face in 2024. "I will make an effort to see that all the Opposition parties work together. If they do, it will be good," he said.

339.title: Tried giving Civil Services Exam many times but kept on failing: Big B
339.article_body: Actor Amitabh Bachchan said he tried giving the Civil Services Exam "many times" after college but kept on "failing". Discussing his struggle, Amitabh had earlier stated, "There was a lot of rejection because everywhere I went, I failed to get a job...I was either not qualified enough or I was too shy." "[It was] terribly frustrating," he'd added.

340.title: End military activities at Europe's largest nuclear plant in Ukraine: UN
340.article_body: The UN Secretary-General Antonio Guterres called for an immediate end to all military activity around Europe's largest nuclear power plant in Ukraine, as Moscow and Kyiv blamed each other for renewed shelling. Guterres warned that any damage could lead to "catastrophic consequences" in the region and beyond. He called for a demilitarised zone to be established around the Zaporizhzhia plant.

341.title: Avoid large gatherings during I-Day amid COVID surge: Centre to states
341.article_body: Amid surge in COVID-19 cases across the country, the central government has asked states to ensure there are no large gatherings for Independence Day celebrations. "It's imperative that Covid guidelines are followed," Centre said. Further, the Home Ministry has asked all states and Union Territories to carry out a 'Swachh Bharat' campaign at a key location in each district.

342.title: 24-yr-old man swept away in Indore drain, body found 150 metres from site
342.article_body: The body of a 24-year-old man who was swept away in a swollen drain in Madhya Pradesh's Indore was found on Thursday. The man, Zakir Khan, had accidentally fallen into the swollen drain on Wednesday when he was trying to stop other people from entering the water body. Khan's body was found about 150 metres away from the site.

343.title: The box office start has sent shockwaves: Girish on 'Laal...', 'Raksha...'
343.article_body: Girish Johar, who is a co-producer of Aishwarya Rai Bachchan-starrer 'Jazbaa', said the box office start of 'Laal Singh Chaddha' and 'Raksha Bandhan' has sent "shockwaves". "Imagine that Aamir Khan coming after four years and Akshay Kumar...combined are not even clocking ₹20 crore on a big holiday release," added Girish. "No one wants to watch [a] bad film," he stated.

344.title: UP CM announces ₹4 lakh ex-gratia for families of those killed in Banda boat mishap
344.article_body: Uttar Pradesh Chief Minister Yogi Adityanath on Friday announced ex-gratia of ₹4 lakh each for families of people who died in boat mishap in Banda. The Chief Minister has also given instructions for immediate help and relief to the victims and proper treatment to those injured in the accident. The boat capsized due to strong winds, police had earlier said.

345.title: 2,000 live cartridges recovered in Delhi ahead of Independence Day; 6 arrested
345.article_body: As many as 2,000 live cartridges have been recovered in Delhi ahead of Independence Day and six persons have been arrested, police said. The accused were arrested from the Anand Vihar area in the national capital with two bags of cartridges. Those arrested are being questioned about where the 2,000 live cartridges were to be supplied, police added.

346.title: Boulders fall on railway tracks on Mumbai-Pune line; trains delayed
346.article_body: A few trains were delayed after boulders and muck fell on the railway tracks between the Nagnath-Palasdhari section and the Lonavala-Karjat Ghat section on the Mumbai-Pune line around 12.50 am on Friday, railway officials said. The boulders, that fell on the Up-line which goes towards Mumbai, were removed by 8.15 am after which services were restored, officials added.

347.title: Light to moderate rainfall in Pune till August 15, no warnings: IMD
347.article_body: India Meteorological Department (IMD) predicted light to moderate rains in Pune and isolated heavy rains in ghat regions for Friday. From August 13 to August 15, light rains are very likely in Pune, it added. IMD released no warnings for Pune and ghat regions from Friday onwards. "The monsoon trough...oscillates around its normal position till August 16," an official said.

348.title: Shapoorji Pallonji to offload 1.25% stake in Sterling and Wilson
