348.article_body: Shapoorji Pallonji And Company Private Limited has proposed to offload its 1.25% stake, which comprises up to 23,70,787 equity shares, in Sterling and Wilson Renewable Energy Limited (SWREL). The floor price of the offer shall be ₹270 per equity share of the company, SWREL said. The offer for sale (OFS) will take place on Friday for non-retail investors.

349.title: Dwayne Bravo creates history, becomes 1st bowler to take 600 wickets in T20 cricket
349.article_body: West Indian all-rounder Dwayne Bravo has created history by becoming the first bowler to take 600 wickets in T20 cricket. The 38-year-old reached the 600-wicket mark after picking up two wickets for Northern Superchargers against Oval Invincibles in The Hundred on Thursday. He reached 600 wickets in 516 T20 innings.

350.title: 3 schoolgirls kidnapped, raped in Delhi; 2 women among those arrested
350.article_body: Three schoolgirls were kidnapped and raped after being given beverages laced with sedatives in Delhi's Rohini, police said on Thursday. Four people, including two women, have been arrested in connection with this case, police added. Girls said that one of the accused took them to a house where they were kept hostage and raped.

351.title: 2 from B'desh arrested for using drone near Kolkata's Victoria Memorial
351.article_body: Two Bangladeshi nationals were arrested for allegedly using a drone near Kolkata's Victoria Memorial Hall on Wednesday, police said. The accused were reportedly taking pictures of the memorial and its surrounding areas without any permission. "Flying drones in and around the Victoria Memorial Hall is prohibited as it's a no-drone zone and...falls in the defence area," an official said.

352.title: SC sets August 28 as new deadline for Noida twin towers demolition
352.article_body: Supreme Court has given an additional time of one week for the demolition of Supertech's twin 40-storey towers in Uttar Pradesh's Noida. The demolition, which was scheduled for August 21, will now take place on August 28. SC has also granted a seven-day buffer, from August 29 to September 4, in case of any "technical glitches or weather-related problems".

353.title: Taliban cleric who supported female education killed by bomb hidden in artificial limb
353.article_body: A prominent Afghan cleric who supported the Taliban and was in favour of female education has been killed. Sheikh Rahimullah Haqqani was targeted by a man who detonated explosives hidden in an artificial plastic limb, Reuters said quoting Taliban sources. The Islamic State (IS) group claimed responsibility for the bombing saying it happened inside his office.

354.title: It's a sad loss: Mumbai chief selector on Arjun Tendulkar playing for Goa
354.article_body: Mumbai chief selector Salil Ankola has termed Sachin Tendulkar's son Arjun Tendulkar's decision to represent Goa as a "sad loss for Mumbai cricket". "He wasn't getting many opportunities in Mumbai because there were already a set of fast bowlers playing...I am sure Goa is going to gain a lot out of him," added Ankola. "Arjun works very hard," he stated.

355.title: Govt shares pics of man wiping metro floor after co-passenger drops food; praises him
355.article_body: The government has shared pictures of a man wiping the floor of a metro train. "Here's a citizen who walks the talk of #Swachhata. Pranjal Dubey showed the true meaning of #JanBhagidari by picking up the food spilled on the floor by a co-passenger & wiping the floor with his handkerchief," it tweeted.

356.title: My kiss in 'Darlings' took me by surprise, it's a sweet, delicate moment: Shefali
356.article_body: Actress Shefali Shah said that her kiss scene in 'Darlings' took her by surprise, adding that it was a sweet and delicate moment. "I thought, 'Hain, ye kya ho gaya (Wow, what just happened)," she said. "One of the shots we did...I ran to kiss him and [my] bag hit my face and we both kissed the bag," Shefali added.

357.title: Woman asks Delhi HC to stop 48-yr-old Noida man's trip to Europe for euthanasia
357.article_body: A Bengaluru-based woman has moved Delhi High Court, asking it to stop her 48-year-old Noida-based friend with Chronic Fatigue Syndrome from travelling to Europe allegedly to undergo euthanasia. The plea stated that he's bed bound and just able to walk a few steps. The woman pleaded that his parents would suffer "irreparable loss" and "hardship" if his trip isn't halted.

358.title: Avinash used to be so lazy, he would eat vada pav daily, jokes brother
358.article_body: Talking about Avinash Sable, who is the first Indian athlete to win a medal in 3,000m steeplechase event at CWG, having bagged silver at CWG 2022, his brother Yogesh jokingly said Avinash used to be "very lazy". Yogesh added that Avinash would eat vada pav daily after college. "He had put on so much [weight]," stated their father Mukund.

359.title: Odisha govt to distribute 30 lakh National Flags for free
359.article_body: The Odisha government will distribute 30 lakh National Flags for free ahead of Independence Day. "There is great enthusiasm among the people of the country to mark the occasion, extensive preparations are being made for this at the government and private levels," the official statement read. The 'Har Ghar Tiranga' campaign will be held from August 13 to 15.

360.title: Aryan Khan's debut web show to be satire on film industry: Report
360.article_body: Shah Rukh Khan's son Aryan Khan is working on his debut web show which will be a satire on the film industry, reported PeepingMoon. As per the report, Aryan will serve as the showrunner but might not direct it. He is reportedly working with a team of writers at Red Chillies Entertainment and will take it on floors in 2023.

361.title: Russian reporter who called Putin a 'killer' put under house arrest
361.article_body: A Russian court on Thursday placed former state TV journalist Marina Ovsyannikova under house arrest for nearly two months, pending an investigation on charges of spreading false information about Russia's armed forces. Marina Ovsyannikova was charged over a street protest last month when she held up a banner calling Russian President Vladimir Putin a "killer" and his soldiers "fascists".

362.title: Valuations of US startups seeking early-stage funding contract
362.article_body: US startups seeking early-stage funding have seen a decline in valuations in Q2 as investors become more cautious. Investors are urging founders to make more concessions, as last year's easy fiscal policies and stimulus measures that led to an investment frenzy are fading away. Median pre-money valuation for early-stage funding rounds was down 16% from Q1, as per a report.

363.title: French Air Force contingent makes stopover at IAF's Sulur base
363.article_body: As part of a mega military operation, a French Air and Space Force contingent, which included three Rafale jets, made a stopover at the Indian Air Force's Sulur station in Tamil Nadu. A French readout said that the cooperation with the IAF demonstrated a high level of mutual trust and interoperability between the two sides.

364.title: Man tries to drown woman in public fountain in Spain; pics show 2 men saving her
364.article_body: A woman was rescued by two bystanders after a man appeared to be forcing her head down into a public fountain in broad daylight in Spain's Valencia. Pictures and video of the incident have surfaced online, showing two men jumping inside the fountain before punching and hitting the man to save the woman.

365.title: Johnson & Johnson to stop selling talc-based baby powder after 38,000 cancer lawsuits
365.article_body: Johnson & Johnson has announced that it will stop making and selling its talc-based baby powder around the world from next year. The company will transition to an all cornstarch-based baby powder portfolio, which is already sold worldwide. Johnson & Johnson faces 38,000 lawsuits from consumers and their survivors claiming its talc products caused cancer due to contamination with asbestos.

366.title: There are concerns over Shaheen's fitness, hope he'll play Asia Cup: Babar
366.article_body: Pakistan captain Babar Azam said there are "concerns" over pacer Shaheen Shah Afridi's fitness, adding that he hopes Shaheen will play in the Asia Cup 2022. "We are trying to ensure he can get ready as soon as possible," added Babar. Team India pacers Jasprit Bumrah and Harshal Patel are not available for the tournament due to injuries.

367.title: Massive fire breaks out at hotel near Gujarat's Jamnagar, 27 rescued
367.article_body: A massive fire broke out at a five-storey hotel near Gujarat's Jamnagar on Thursday and 27 people were rescued, police said. "The fire started around 7.30 pm...27 guests were staying in 18 of the total 36 rooms. They were all rescued...Hotel staff too is safe," police added. The fire was brought under control around 10.30 pm, police stated.

368.title: Delhi AQI to be 'satisfactory', city to witness 'moderate temperature'
368.article_body: System of Air Quality and Weather Forecasting and Research on Thursday said that Delhi will witness "moderate temperature" in coming days. "For...next 3 days...AQI is likely to be within 'satisfactory' or 'lower end of moderate' due to expected light rain/drizzle spells. Moderate temperature (~ 34-35 deg C) and mixing layer height (~ 2.0) [to] maintain moderate ventilation," the agency said.

369.title: Bengaluru CCB arrests 2 serial extortioners, seizes ₹78 lakh-phones
369.article_body: The Central Crime Branch (CCB) of the Bengaluru City Police has arrested two serial extortioners who were wanted in several cases of mobile phone thefts, the police tweeted on Thursday. The police said that 512 smartphones worth ₹78 lakh have also been seized. The accused used to sell the extorted mobile phones in Mumbai, Hyderabad and Delhi, the police added.

370.title: 4 female, 3 male students suspended over 'inappropriate act' in Assam classroom
370.article_body: A college in Assam has suspended seven students after a video showing them engaging in an "inappropriate act" in a classroom surfaced on social media. Principal of the college said, "The students did this turpitude act in tiffin hours when no teachers were present." Four of the seven students are female, and three are male.

371.title: Dabur India Chairman Amit Burman resigns
371.article_body: Dabur India on Friday announced that the board has accepted Chairman Amit Burman's resignation with effect from August 10, 2022. Burman will continue to serve as the Non-Executive Director for the company. When Dabur Foods forayed into the processed food industry in 1999, Burman took over as the CEO. In 2019, he took charge as the Chairman of Dabur India.

372.title: Search operation resumes for 17 missing people as boat capsizes in UP
372.article_body: Teams of the National Disaster Response Force (NDRF) and the State Disaster Response Force (SDRF) resumed search operation this morning for 17 missing people after their boat capsized in the Yamuna river in UP's Banda district. The boat was carrying 30 to 40 people and was going from Fatehpur to Marka village. Three bodies have been recovered till now.

373.title: Punjab Assembly Speaker's security staff assault truck driver; he apologises
373.article_body: Punjab Assembly Speaker Kultar Singh Sandhwan's security personnel allegedly brutally thrashed a truck driver after the truck rammed into Sandhwan's car on the Amritsar-Jalandhar bypass road on Thursday. A purported video of the incident has surfaced online. Sandhwan, who escaped unhurt, later said that his security staff had argued with the truck driver and apologised for it.

374.title: Akshay's 'Raksha Bandhan' opens at ₹7.5 cr, his worst opening of 2022
374.article_body: Actor Akshay Kumar's third film of 2022 'Raksha Bandhan' collected ₹7.5 crore on its opening day making it his worst opening of the year. His earlier films 'Bachchhan Paandey' and 'Samrat Prithviraj' had earned ₹13.2 crore and ₹10.7 crore on their opening days, respectively. 'Raksha Bandhan' clashed with Aamir Khan-starrer 'Laal Singh Chaddha' which collected ₹10.75 crore at its opening.

375.title: BMTC to offer free bus rides on all routes on Independence Day
375.article_body: Bengaluru Metropolitan Transport Corporation (BMTC), in order to mark its 25 years, has decided to give free bus services on all routes on Independence Day. The service will cover all ordinary, AC and special Volvo buses run by BMTC. Further, on August 16, the corporation will present medals to drivers who haven't been involved in any accidents during their service.

376.title: A must-watch, joyful ride: Rajkummar Rao on 'Laal Singh Chaddha'
376.article_body: Actor Rajkummar Rao on Thursday took to Instagram Stories to appreciate Aamir Khan and Kareena Kapoor-starrer 'Laal Singh Chaddha'. The actor wrote, "'Laal Singh Chaddha' is a [must-watch]. Such a beautiful film. What a joyful emotional ride...And the most wonderful surprise cameo ever." The Advait Chandan directorial features a special appearance by actor Shah Rukh Khan.

377.title: Car falls into river under bridge in Pune; 5 of family rescued
377.article_body: The fire brigade rescued five members of a family, including two children, after their car fell into the river under Pune's SM Joshi Bridge on Friday. The firemen rescued the family using ropes, life jackets and other equipment. The car was washed away by the river's current, which had apparently strengthened after water was released from a dam.

378.title: Elon Musk responds after Ford CEO mocks him over Tesla's delayed EV truck
378.article_body: Tesla CEO Elon Musk has responded after Ford CEO Jim Farley mocked the electric car company over its delayed release of Cybertruck and called Ford's F-150 Lightning the "leader of all EV pickup trucks" in the United States. "Take that, Elon Musk," Farley further said during an event. Responding to this, Musk said, "Thanks, but I already have one."

379.title: UP govt to induct 100 youths under CM fellowship programme for governance
379.article_body: The Uttar Pradesh government is planning to recruit about 100 youths under its Chief Minister fellowship programme for governance. The government has invited applications to appoint one research scholar for each of the 100 backward blocks of the state to work on policymaking, research and development. A budget of ₹5.58 crore has been allotted for the programme in first year.

380.title: 31 injured after 2 rollercoaster trains collide at Legoland in Germany
380.article_body: At least 31 people were injured after two rollercoaster trains collided at Legoland's theme park in Germany on Thursday. Three helicopters were deployed to the scene. People reportedly had to be carried down from a height of at least 16 feet. Last week, a 57-year-old woman died after falling from a moving rollercoaster in an amusement park in Germany's Klotten.

381.title: Woman beaten, clothes forcibly removed in Madhya Pradesh; 4 arrested
381.article_body: Police arrested four persons after a woman was beaten and her clothes were forcibly removed in Madhya Pradesh's Jhabua. This comes after she returned to her husband whom she had left eight months ago and went to live with her partner. The incident took place when the woman's partner came to her village to take her back with him.

382.title: Aditya Birla Health Insurance to get ₹665 cr investment from ADIA
382.article_body: The boards of Aditya Birla Capital and Aditya Birla Health Insurance have approved a proposal to infuse ₹665 crore capital into the health insurer from an Abu Dhabi Investment Authority (ADIA) subsidiary. ADIA will hold 9.99% stake in Aditya Birla Health Insurance, while Aditya Birla Capital and South Africa-based Momentum Metropolitan Holdings will own a 45.91% and 44.10% stake, respectively.

383.title: Barcelona's Aubameyang picks Lionel Messi over Cristiano Ronaldo
383.article_body: Barcelona striker Pierre-Emerick Aubameyang picked Lionel Messi over Manchester United's Cristiano Ronaldo when asked to choose between the two during an interview. Aubameyang further went on to select arch-rivals Real Madrid over Premier League club Tottenham Hotspur. Responding to a query over the player he will pick between Rafael Nadal and Roger Federer, Aubameyang named Nadal.

384.title: Vigilance agency raids 26 premises of former TN CM Palaniswami's aide
384.article_body: The Directorate of Vigilance and Anti-Corruption conducted raids at 26 premises of former AIADMK MLA, KPP Baskar, and his family in connection with a disproportionate assets case. Baskar is a close aide of former Tamil Nadu CM and AIADMK's interim General Secretary Edappadi Palaniswami. The agency claimed that Baskar's assets were disproportionate to that of his income by ₹4.72 crore.

385.title: Actor Alec Baldwin's wife responds to rumours that her baby bump is fake
385.article_body: Actor Alec Baldwin's wife Hilaria has responded to rumours that her baby bump is fake. "My friends made a good point about my belly. It kind of looks like a fake...like I ate a ball...I guess the psycho conspiracy theorists online with way too much time on their hands have somewhat of a point here," she wrote on Instagram.

386.title: Samsung's billionaire heir jailed for bribery gets presidential pardon in S Korea
386.article_body: Samsung's billionaire heir Lee Jae-yong, who was sentenced to jail last year over bribery and embezzlement, received a presidential pardon in South Korea on Friday. The country's minister Han Dong-hoon said Lee Jae-yong will be "reinstated" to give him a chance to "contribute to overcoming the economic crisis". He was released on parole in August last year.

387.title: Armed man tries to enter FBI office in Ohio, shot dead in standoff
387.article_body: An armed man was killed after he tried to "breach" an FBI building in Cincinnati, Ohio, on Thursday, officials said. The man had fled the scene after the attempted breach and was shot dead following a car chase, gun battle and a standoff in a rural area, they added. Authorities are probing if he'd ties to the far-right extremist groups.

388.title: Driver carrying cargo to UP finds over 15 feet long python under truck seat
388.article_body: A driver who was carrying cargo from Madhya Pradesh to Uttar Pradesh in his truck found a 15 feet long python curled up under his seat, reports said. The driver felt some movement under his seat when he stopped for a meal. He alerted people around him and a forest team was called in to get the reptile out.

389.title: India reports 16,561 new COVID-19 cases, active cases stand at 1,23,535
389.article_body: India has reported 16,561 COVID-19 cases in the last 24 hours, according to the Ministry of Health and Family Welfare. This comes a day after the country saw 16,299 COVID-19 cases. Active cases in India stand at 1,23,535, while the death toll has risen to 5,26,928, according to the latest data.

390.title: Aamir's 'Laal Singh Chaddha' opens at ₹10.75 cr, his lowest in 13 years
390.article_body: Aamir Khan-starrer 'Laal Singh Chaddha' collected ₹10.75 crore on its opening day, as per Box Office India. This is the actor's lowest opening in the last 13 years. His 2018 film 'Thugs of Hindostan' had opened at ₹52 crore. 'Laal Singh Chaddha' recorded the third biggest opening for a Hindi film in 2022 after 'Bhool Bhulaiyaa 2' and 'Bachchhan Paandey'.

391.title: Wish 'Samrat Prithviraj' worked, but we have to accept failures: Sonu Sood
391.article_body: Speaking about the box office failure of 'Samrat Prithviraj', actor Sonu Sood said that he wishes the film had done well, adding that it is one of the special films of his career. "You have to accept your failures and learn from them and next time you can be better, you can deliver better," the actor added.

392.title: 20-year-old woman afraid of failing CA examination kills self in Nagpur
392.article_body: A 20-year-old woman, who was preparing for Chartered Accountancy (CA) examination, allegedly died by suicide, fearing failure. The incident took place in wee hours of Wednesday, an official said. The official further said that the woman had, before taking the step, messaged her mother and other family members, stating that she was scared of failing the exam.

393.title: Shah Rukh Khan to play Vanar Astra in 'Brahmāstra', pics leaked
393.article_body: Pictures and videos have surfaced on social media showing actor Shah Rukh Khan as Vanar Astra in Ayan Mukerji's upcoming film 'Brahmāstra'. The film, which is part one of a trilogy, features Ranbir Kapoor, Alia Bhatt, Amitabh Bachchan and Mouni Roy. Shah Rukh recently made cameo appearances in Aamir Khan's 'Laal Singh Chaddha' and R Madhavan's 'Rocketry: The Nambi Effect'.

394.title: Bring back Congress for completion of projects in Raj: Gehlot urges people
394.article_body: Rajasthan CM Ashok Gehlot on Thursday urged people to vote for Congress in the next state Assembly polls, saying his government's ouster will stall ongoing development projects. Gehlot said the Barmer refinery project was delayed as Congress was ousted from power in 2014. "Only if our government is repeated, we would be able to complete ongoing projects," Gehlot added.

395.title: Axar has stronger claim than Jadeja as pure bowler: Manjrekar on T20 WC
395.article_body: Ex-India batter Sanjay Manjrekar said Axar Patel and Ravichandran Ashwin have a "stronger" claim than Ravindra Jadeja, considering the role of a pure bowler, in India's squad for T20 World Cup 2022. "Jadeja isn't somebody you can go to in...first six overs whereas you can with Axar," added Manjrekar. "Jadeja...knows there is some serious competition coming in," he stated.

396.title: Paytm CEO Vijay Shekhar's reappointment opposed by advisory firm
396.article_body: The Institutional Investor Advisory Services India (IiAS) has advised shareholders to vote against the reappointment of Vijay Shekhar Sharma as the Chief Executive Officer (CEO) of Paytm parent One97 Communications. It has also opposed his remuneration. The advisory firm said it believes "the board must consider professionalising the management” as Sharma's "commitments" haven't played out.

397.title: Sensex falls 68 points, Nifty at 17,639 in opening trade
397.article_body: The benchmark indices opened in red on Friday with Sensex and Nifty falling 68.30 points and 19.20 points, respectively. The Sensex opened at 59,264.30 points and Nifty at 17,639.80. ONGC, IndusInd Bank, Titan Company, ICICI Bank and Hindalco were among the major Nifty gainers, while Apollo Hospitals, Tata Motors, Tech Mahindra, Infosys and Wipro slipped.

398.title: Migrant labourer from Bihar shot dead by terrorists in J&K's Bandipora
398.article_body: A migrant labourer from Bihar's Madhepura, identified as Mohd Amrez, was shot dead by terrorists on Thursday at Soadnara Sumbal in Jammu and Kashmir's Bandipora. "During the intervening night, terrorists fired upon Mohd Amrez...He was shifted to a hospital...where he succumbed," police said. "We thought he went to toilet...saw him lying in a pool of blood," the deceased's brother said.

399.title: Trump's Florida home raided by FBI in search of nuclear documents: Report
399.article_body: The FBI agents were looking for documents relating to nuclear weapons when they raided former US President Donald Trump's home in Florida this week, The Washington Post has reported. However, it was unclear if such documents were recovered at Trump's Mar-a-Lago resort. On Thursday, the Justice Department lawyers filed a motion seeking to unseal the search warrant in the case.

400.title: It was a dummy plane: Influencer Bobby Kataria after smoking video goes viral
400.article_body: After a video of Bobby Kataria smoking inside a plane went viral on social media, the influencer said that the video was shot in a dummy plane that was a part of his shooting. "How can a lighter make its way into an airplane?" he said. Meanwhile, SpiceJet said the video was shot on January 20, 2022.

401.title: Within 4 mins, robbers loot ₹13 lakh from bank in Punjab; probe on
401.article_body: A probe has been initiated after five armed robbers stole ₹13 lakh from a branch of the Punjab National Bank in a village in Punjab's Ludhiana before escaping within four minutes on Thursday. The bank had no security guard. The accused also took bank employees' phones so that they couldn't inform the police, which the former threw away before escaping.

402.title: Yen falls the most against US dollar as markets rethink Fed move
402.article_body: With markets expecting the US Federal Reserve to do much more to contain inflation, the Japanese yen fell the most against the US dollar on Friday. On Thursday, the dollar index rose 0.1% to 105.210, while the yen fell 0.12% to 133.19 per dollar. The sterling traded down 0.23% at $1.21 and the euro fell to $1.03 against the dollar.

403.title: May not be qualified enough: Pankaja Munde on not being in Maha cabinet
403.article_body: Bharatiya Janata Party leader Pankaja Munde said that she "may not be qualified enough" to be inducted into the Maharashtra cabinet. "Whoever is eligible according to them will be inducted into the cabinet. I have no stand about it. I try to do my politics by maintaining my pride," Munde added after expansion of the cabinet.
